content.title: Institutions of Eminence scheme
content.details: The scheme Institutions of Eminence has been launched by the University Grants Commission in 2017 to empower Higher Educational Institutions to help them become world-class teaching and research institutions. The objective of the scheme is to provide an enabling regulatory architecture to ten public and ten private Higher Educational institutions to emerge as world-class Teaching and Research institutions. This will enhance affordable access to high-quality education for ordinary Indians.
benefits: Financial Assistance would be provided to Government institutions up to ₹ 1000 crore additional funding from the government.

The Institution would have the full freedom to mobilize resources from the industry or alumni or other donors and utilize it in accordance with its implementation plan without having to seek any permission from any authority.
The Institutions of Eminence would be free to admit maximum 30% foreign students of the total admitted students.
Institutions would be free to fix and charge fees from foreign students without restriction.

The Institutions of Eminence would have the freedom to determine the domestic student fees, subject to the condition that credible programmes of scholarships and loans to ensure that the needy are able to pursue higher studies without any financial problems.
The Institutions of Eminence shall have complete flexibility in fixing of curriculum and syllabus, with no University Grant Commission (UGC) mandated curriculum structure.
Academic collaborations with foreign higher educational institutions ranked in top 500 in global rankings would be exempt from government approvals.
eligibility: 10 institutions chosen as Institutions of Eminence.
Mix of technical, management/arts, and central universities.
Top 50 in category on latest National Ranking Framework.
OR top 500 in Times Higher Education, QS, or Shanghai Ranking.
documents_required: Provide information about the organization's structure.
Detail existing and expected revenue sources, expenditures, and corpus funds.
Specify the available land for the institution.
Outline the governance structure, including the apex board.
Present a comprehensive five-year implementation plan consisting of various academic and administrative plans.
Include a plan for involving alumni in institution management and leveraging their financial resources.
Develop a sustainability plan for the post-public funding period.
If provisions exist, provide a plan for affiliating other higher education institutions in the 15-year perspective plan.

faqs.question: What is Institutions of Eminence(IOEs) scheme?
faqs.answer: Institutions of Eminence scheme has been launched in order to empower Higher Educational Institutions and to help them become world-class teaching and research institutions.

faqs.question: What are the facilities of this scheme?
faqs.answer: Financial Assistance would be provided to Government institutions up to ₹ 1000 crore additional funding from the government along with other benefits.

faqs.question: Which department has launched Institutions of Eminence(IOEs) scheme?
faqs.answer: Institutions of Eminence(IOEs) scheme has been launched by the Department of Higher Education.

faqs.question: What kind of institution can apply for this scheme?
faqs.answer: As per the guidelines, Government institutions can apply for this scheme as of now.

faqs.question: Is any institution eligible being in the top fifty of the ranking in their category under the latest National Institution Ranking Framework?
faqs.answer: Yes, those institutions are eligible to apply.

faqs.question: Is any institution eligible being in top 500 of some of the internationally recognized ranking frameworks such as the Times Higher Education World University Rankings or QS or SJTU (Shanghai's Jiao Tong University)?
faqs.answer: Yes, those institutions are eligible to apply.

faqs.question: How Central Government controlled institutions can apply?
faqs.answer: Central Government controlled institutions can apply through controlling Ministry/Department.

faqs.question: How State Public Universities can apply?
faqs.answer: State Public Universities can apply through state government.

faqs.question: How many parts would be there in the application process?
faqs.answer: The application will have two parts: a fifteen-year strategic vision plan as well as a five-year implementation plan.

faqs.question: Is there any application fee for the submission in the scheme?
faqs.answer: Processing fee of Rupees ₹1,00,00,000/- by way of Demand Draft need to deposit for the submission in the scheme.

faqs.question: In case any refund will be made to the applicant who were not selected?
faqs.answer: Yes, ₹ 75,00,000/- seventy-five lakh shall be returned to applicants who are not selected as institutions of Eminence.
